title: New Cisco tools aim to enable green networks, data centers - TechTarget
summary: Cisco has announced its commitment to achieve net zero by 2040 and is focused on sustainability as a core part of its business strategy. The company provides eco-friendly networking products that improve energy efficiency and help organizations modernize their data centers while minimizing their environmental impact. Cisco highlights the financial benefits and operational efficiencies that come with adopting greener technologies. They continue to prioritize metrics and visibility in energy consumption as an essential component of their sustainability initiatives.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes Cisco's efforts to provide eco-friendly networking products and modernize infrastructure with a focus on reducing energy consumption and environmental impact, aligning with green innovation definitions.
business_innovation: TRUE. The updates to Cisco's eco-friendly products and networking solutions represent new or improved business processes that differ significantly from previous offerings and are introduced to the market.
green_product: TRUE. The Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS) X-Series servers are designed to operate more efficiently with a reduced physical footprint and lower power consumption, fitting the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE. The modernisation process that includes real-time energy metrics, process automation, and utilizing energy-efficient technologies is a clear example of a green process aimed at reducing environmental impact.
product_or_process: Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS) X-Series servers
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 334111 - Electronic Computer Manufacturing, 334210 - Telephone Apparatus Manufacturing, 511210 - Software Publishers, 541519 - Other Computer Related Services.
greenwashing: FALSE. The article presents a genuine commitment from Cisco towards sustainability and does not indicate any misleading claims about their environmental benefits.
